main event: On May 2, 1955, in Sacramento, California, a silver object, possibly spherical and the size of a penny held at arm's length, was observed moving at a speed much greater than that of a conventional jet. There was no follow-up investigation due to the brevity of the sighting and delay in report receipt.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be moving at a speed much greater than that of a conventional jet.
The report mentions sightings in various locations, including Davis, Mather AFB, and northeast of Mather AFB, with details of the objects' trajectories and behavior.
A U.S. Air Force officer observed a bright white light performing unusual flight patterns and speeds in Sacramento on May 6, 1955, indicating it was not a conventional aircraft.
Multiple other sightings were reported across different locations in June 1955, including Woodside and Inglewood, California, Cape Cod, Massachusetts, and Kennebunk, Washington.
The report highlights a LAPA photo of 6 objects in Hamburg, Germany, and additional reported sightings in Adelaide, Australia.
witnesses: U.S. Air Force officer, John Smith from Dept. of Civil Air Operations
